intro: Calceolaria stenanthera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive calyx-like structure that resembles a slipper, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
